bug.author: mattnworb
bug.summary: `kfctl init --version v0.6.1` generates app.yaml that uses v0.6.1-rc.2 of manifests repo
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: [A clear and concise description of what the bug is.]
Downloaded kfctl 0.6.1 from the Releases page ran kfctl init kf-test --version v0.6.1
I noticed that the manifests repo included in the generated app.yaml is referring to a different release: <denchmark-code>$ tail -20 kf-test/app.yaml - tf-training - pipeline - istio - application repo: /Users/mattbrown/code/kubeflow-deployment/clusters/kf-test/.cache/kubeflow/v0.6.1/kubeflow repos: - name: kubeflow uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/tarball/v0.6.1?archive=tar.gz - name: manifests root: manifests-v0.6.1-rc.2 uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz useBasicAuth: false useIstio: true version: v0.6.1 status: reposCache: kubeflow: localPath: '"/Users/mattbrown/code/kubeflow-deployment/clusters/kf-test/.cache/kubeflow/kubeflow-kubeflow-3a37cbc"' manifests: localPath: '"/Users/mattbrown/code/kubeflow-deployment/clusters/kf-test/.cache/manifests/manifests-0.6.1-rc.2"'
</denchmark-code>
What did you expect to happen: Should the manifests and kubeflow repos in app.yaml be at the same release tag?
